alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Jackson; Jefferson; Osage; Shawnee; Wabaunsee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 19 at 7:45PM CDT until April 19 at 8:30PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN JEFFERSON...SHAWNEE...NORTHERN DOUGLAS...EAST CENTRAL WABAUNSEE...NORTHEASTERN OSAGE AND SOUTHEASTERN JACKSON COUNTIES... At 744 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Willard to 4 miles north of Auburn to near Carbondale, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Public. At 744 pm, the public reported a 68 mph wind gust near Dover. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Topeka, Lawrence, Carbondale, Valley Falls, Rossville, Oskaloosa, Tecumseh, Richland, Dover, Silver Lake, Auburn, Perry, Meriden, Scranton, Ozawkie, Lecompton, Maple Hill, Clinton, Willard and Pauline. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 between mile markers 337 and 355. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 162 and 205. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for northeastern and east central Kansas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Douglas; Jackson; Jefferson; Osage; Shawnee; Wabaunsee
